intro: Hieracium cuphodomum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. It produces yellow flowers with ray florets that resemble petals, and its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture. Hieracium cuphodomum is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
